snippet: For many Southerners, whether to go to Chick-fil-A is not as simple as choosing sides in a cultural war, and they feel protective of a brand rooted in their region’s tradition.
abstract: Many Southerners feel protective of a brand rooted in their region's tradition, complicating the debate over Chick-fil-A; for many Southerners, it is not as simple as choosing sides in a cultural war that has pitted people who support the chain's biblical position on same-sex marriage against those who do not.;
lead_paragraph: For many Southerners, whether to go to Chick-fil-A is not as simple as choosing sides in a cultural war, and they feel protective of a brand rooted in their region’s tradition.

headline.seo: Chick-fil-A Loyalty Is Rooted in Southern Identity
headline.main: A Fast Food Loyalty Rooted in Southern Identity
headline.print_headline: A Fast Food Loyalty Rooted in Southern Identity

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
